column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=I asked his pardon , and he slowly added these words , touching my arm , —

#Text=“ Within six hours after the Appearance , the memorable accident on this Line happened , and within ten hours the dead and wounded were brought along through the tunnel over the spot where the figure had stood . ”
#Text=A disagreeable shudder crept over me , but I did my best against it .
#Text=It was not to be denied , I rejoined , that this was a remarkable coincidence , calculated deeply to impress his mind .
#Text=But it was unquestionable that remarkable coincidences did continually occur , and they must be taken into account in dealing with such a subject .

#Text=Though to be sure I must admit , I added ( for I thought I saw that he was going to bring the objection to bear upon me ) , men of common sense did not allow much for coincidences in making the ordinary calculations of life .
#Text=He again begged to remark that he had not finished .
#Text=I again begged his pardon for being betrayed into interruptions .
#Text=“ This , ” he said , again laying his hand upon my arm , and glancing over his shoulder with hollow eyes , “ was just a year ago .

#Text=Six or seven months passed , and I had recovered from the surprise and shock , when one morning , as the day was breaking , I , standing at the door , looked towards the red light , and saw the spectre again . ”
#Text=He stopped , with a fixed look at me .
#Text=“ Did it cry out ? ”
#Text=“ No. It was silent . ”
#Text=“ Did it wave its arm ? ”
#Text=“ No. It leaned against the shaft of the light , with both hands before the face .
#Text=Like this . ”
#Text=Once more I followed his action with my eyes .
#Text=It was an action of mourning .
#Text=I have seen such an attitude in stone figures on tombs .
#Text=“ Did you go up to it ? ”
#Text=“ I came in and sat down , partly to collect my thoughts , partly because it had turned me faint .
#Text=When I went to the door again , daylight was above me , and the ghost was gone . ”
#Text=“ But nothing followed ?
#Text=Nothing came of this ? ”
#Text=He touched me on the arm with his forefinger twice or thrice giving a ghastly nod each time : —
#Text=“ That very day , as a train came out of the tunnel , I noticed , at a carriage window on my side , what looked like a confusion of hands and heads , and something waved .
#Text=I saw it just in time to signal the driver , Stop !
#Text=He shut off , and put his brake on , but the train drifted past here a hundred and fifty yards or more .
#Text=I ran after it , and , as I went along , heard terrible screams and cries .
#Text=A beautiful young lady had died instantaneously in one of the compartments , and was brought in here , and laid down on this floor between us . ”
#Text=Involuntarily I pushed my chair back , as I looked from the boards at which he pointed to himself .
#Text=“ True , sir .
#Text=True .
#Text=Precisely as it happened , so I tell it you . ”
#Text=I could think of nothing to say , to any purpose , and my mouth was very dry .
#Text=The wind and the wires took up the story with a long lamenting wail .
#Text=He resumed .
#Text=“ Now , sir , mark this , and judge how my mind is troubled .
#Text=The spectre came back a week ago .
#Text=Ever since , it has been there , now and again , by fits and starts . ”
#Text=“ At the light ? ”
#Text=“ At the Danger-light . ”
#Text=“ What does it seem to do ? ”
#Text=He repeated , if possible with increased passion and vehemence , that former gesticulation of , “ For God ’s sake , clear the way ! ”
#Text=Then he went on .
#Text=“ I have no peace or rest for it .
#Text=It calls to me , for many minutes together , in an agonised manner , ‘ Below there !
#Text=Look out ! Look out ! ’
#Text=It stands waving to me .
#Text=It rings my little bell — ”
#Text=I caught at that .
#Text=“ Did it ring your bell yesterday evening when I was here , and you went to the door ? ”
#Text=“ Twice . ”
#Text=“ Why , see , ” said I , “ how your imagination misleads you .
#Text=My eyes were on the bell , and my ears were open to the bell , and if I am a living man , it did NOT ring at those times .
#Text=No , nor at any other time , except when it was rung in the natural course of physical things by the station communicating with you . ”
#Text=He shook his head .
#Text=“ I have never made a mistake as to that yet , sir .
#Text=I have never confused the spectre ’s ring with the man ’s .
#Text=The ghost ’s ring is a strange vibration in the bell that it derives from nothing else , and I have not asserted that the bell stirs to the eye .
#Text=I do n’t wonder that you failed to hear it .
#Text=But I heard it . ”
#Text=“ And did the spectre seem to be there , when you looked out ? ”
#Text=“ It WAS there . ”
#Text=“ Both times ? ”
#Text=He repeated firmly :
#Text=“ Both times . ”
#Text=“ Will you come to the door with me , and look for it now ? ”
#Text=He bit his under lip as though he were somewhat unwilling , but arose .
#Text=I opened the door , and stood on the step , while he stood in the doorway .
#Text=There was the Danger-light .
#Text=There was the dismal mouth of the tunnel .
#Text=There were the high , wet stone walls of the cutting .
#Text=There were the stars above them .
#Text=“ Do you see it ? ” I asked him , taking particular note of his face .
#Text=His eyes were prominent and strained , but not very much more so , perhaps , than my own had been when I had directed them earnestly towards the same spot .
